title: Moment Christine McGuinness doubts joining Celebs Go Dating
description: Christine McGuinness showed clear signs she wanted to leave the programme during the first episode of Celebs Go Dating on Monday night.
content:
Christine McGuinness showed clear signs she wanted to leave the programme during the first episode of Celebs Go Dating on Monday night.

The model, 37, who announced she had quit the show in May, appeared visibly uncomfortable during the mixer when the celebs were tasked to pick someone to take to Ibiza in the hope they would get closer.

But all seemed too much for Christine as she insisted on 'taking a minute' outside with her fellow co-star Kerry Katona.

She panicked: 'I need a minute, I can go for a minute can't I? I don't want to just take someone away.

'How can I go abroad with someone I've just met? This is just not normal.'

When it was announced she would appear on the show, it was revealed that Christine would be up for dating both men and women on the show.

Christine revealed it felt 'too soon' for her to date so publicly following her divorce from ex-husband Paddy McGuinness.

She had already flown to Ibiza to begin filming the series with the rest of the cast but told fans she was 'returning home to her family' after having a change of heart.

Revealing the news on Instagram, she said: 'I joined Celebs Go Dating with great intentions but have realised that dating on a public platform and the attention is brings is just too soon for me.'

Christine also said that she may appear in the future, adding: 'They've said the door is always open for me which I'm so grateful but for now I'm returning home to my family.'

Talking on Celebs Go Dating, Christine said: 'I feel like I’m a couple of steps away from being my new self and not ‘Paddy’s wife’. I’m coming out of the transition part.

'I am single and I absolutely do love women. I’d love to explore that more and I definitely see that’s where I’m more comfortable.'

She added: 'When I was a teenager, I dated men and women before I was married and now I’m really, really just enjoying spending time with women.

'For the last three years, I’ve only ever dated women. I was never heterosexual, I’ve never labelled myself anything other than Christine, to be honest.'

Christine was married to TV presenter Paddy for 11 years before they split for good in 2022.

After they stayed living together for the sake of their three children - twins Leo and Penelope, and daughter Felicity, who have all been diagnosed with autism - the exes finalised their divorce out of court last summer.

Christine revealed how 'difficult' the break-up had been for her after the pair's marital home, a Cheshire mansion worth £6.5million, was put on the market.

She said: 'I've never spoken about the reasons for our divorce, and I don't know if I ever will.

'It was a difficult time. It wasn't something that, you know, I just decided to do overnight, or that we chose to do.

'We tried, and, yeah, there just, unfortunately, there was no repairing it, you know?'

Discussing her appearance on the show before deciding to quit, the TV personality has admitted that she hasn't 'dated much before' so this will be a new experience for her.

She said: 'I'm really excited to be joining the agency, I'm going to have a summer of fun! Who knows what might happen? I've not really dated much before, so I feel like I'm doing a crash course!

'I'm looking forward to getting to know the other celebs and I'm especially looking forward to the coaching side of things with the agents. I think that's going to be good for me.'
summary: Model Christine McGuinness, who announced she had quit the show in May, appeared visibly uncomfortable during the first episode of Celebs Go Dating and expressed a desire to leave the programme. She had previously expressed interest in dating both men and women on the show, but felt it felt 'too soon' for her to date publicly following her divorce from ex-husband Paddy McGuinness. Despite initially being invited to the show with the cast, Christine said she was returning home to her family after having a change of heart. She also mentioned that she may appear in the future but stated that she is returning to focus on her family.
shortSummary: Christine McGuinness quit Celebs Go Dating due to emotional struggles, but plans to return and explore dating in the future.

Paddy McGuinness
Paddy McGuinness is an English comedian, actor, and television presenter. He first gained widespread recognition through his collaborations with fellow comedian Peter Kay. McGuinness is best known for hosting the hit dating show Take Me Out from 2010 to 2019. His versatility extends to various genres, having presented shows such as Top Gear, 71 Degrees North and Question of Sport.

Christine McGuinness has announced she will no longer be appearing on the upcoming series of Celebs Go Dating after quitting the process.
The model, 37, revealed that she feels it is 'too soon' for her to date so publicly following her divorce from ex-husband Paddy McGuinness.
Christine had already flown to Ibiza to begin filming the series with the rest of the cast but told fans she was 'returning home to her family' after having a change of heart.
Revealing the news on Instagram on Thursday night, she said: 'I joined Celebs Go Dating with great intentions but have realised that dating on a public platform and the attention is brings is just too soon for me.'
Christine also said that she may appear in the future, adding: 'They've said the door is always open for me which I'm so grateful but for now I'm returning home to my family.'
Hours before the announcement, Christine revealed she was soaking up the sun in Ibiza as she began filming the new series.
Christine McGuinness has announced she will no longer be appearing on the upcoming series of Celebs Go Dating after quitting the process
The model, 37, revealed that she feels it is 'too soon' for her to date so publicly following her divorce from ex-husband Paddy McGuinness (pictured in 2017)
Christine had already flown to Ibiza to begin filming the series with the rest of the cast but told fans she was 'returning home to her family' after having a change of heart
Taking to Instagram, Christine wowed her followers as she showcased her jaw-dropping physique in a tiny purple and neon red bikini.
The bold ensemble featured a plunging triangle top and high-cut thong bottoms, which she paired with sky-high wedge heels.
In the video, the beauty strutted across a submerged path in the pool like it was a catwalk, showing off her incredible frame.
Captioning the clip, she wrote: 'They say Jesus is a man – God is definitely a woman. Just over here casually walking on water in my 5-inch wedges.'
When it was announced she would appear on the show, it was revealed that Christine would be up for dating both men and women on the show.
Christine was married to TV presenter Paddy for 11 years before they split for good in 2022.
After they stayed living together for the sake of their three children - twins Leo and Penelope, and daughter Felicity, who have all been diagnosed with autism - the exes finalised their divorce out of court last summer.
Christine revealed how 'difficult' the break-up had been for her after the pair's marital home, a Cheshire mansion worth £6.5million, was put on the market.
The stunner wowed her followers as she showcased her jaw-dropping physique in a tiny purple and neon red bikini
In the video, the beauty strutted across a submerged path in the pool like it was a catwalk, showing off her incredible frame
Ahead of filming the E4 show, it has been revealed that Christine would be up for dating both men and women on the show (pictured April 30)
She said: 'I've never spoken about the reasons for our divorce, and I don't know if I ever will.
'It was a difficult time. It wasn't something that, you know, I just decided to do overnight, or that we chose to do.
'We tried, and, yeah, there just, unfortunately, there was no repairing it, you know?'
Discussing her appearance on the show before deciding to quit, the TV personality has admitted that she hasn't 'dated much before' so this will be a new experience for her.
She said: 'I'm really excited to be joining the agency, I'm going to have a summer of fun! Who knows what might happen? I've not really dated much before, so I feel like I'm doing a crash course!
'I'm looking forward to getting to know the other celebs and I'm especially looking forward to the coaching side of things with the agents. I think that's going to be good for me.'
Christine was set to join Kerry Katona, 44, Love Island star Olivia Hawkins, 29, S Club 7 singer Jon Lee, 43, and Mark 'The Beast' Labbett, 59, on Celebs Go Dating.
The cast of singletons jetted to the White Isle on Monday to start filming with relationship experts Paul C. Brunson and Anna Williamson, as comedian Rob Beckett returns as the show's narrator.
A TV source told The Sun: 'Show bosses are delighted to have snapped up Christine, they think she'll be great on-screen and appeal to lots of other women in their thirties dating after getting a divorce.
'Fans will see a new side to Christine too as she opens up about her personal life and films coaching sessions with the show's dating experts.
'Christine has been open on social media about how she found spirituality and healing in Ibiza, so she's thrilled to be working over there.'

Christine McGuinness
Christine McGuinness is a model, reality TV personality, and former wife of comedian Paddy McGuinness. She is known for her appearance on The Real Housewives of Cheshire and advocacy work for autism awareness. She has also appeared on a number of television shows including Loose Women, This Morning and Good Morning Britain. she released her autobiography A Beautiful Nightmare: My Story.

Christine McGuinness showed off her incredible figure in a skimpy black and leopard print bikini as she posed for a sizzling Instagram video on Wednesday.
The TV personality wowed in the plunging double layered triangle top which she teamed with matching bottoms.
Christine flaunted her tiny frame as she posed up a storm in the swimwear for a bathroom mirror selfie.
Leaving her long blonde tresses loose, the reality star, who tagged her new fitness social media account @lean_withchristine, accessorised with a silver necklace and a pair of matching earrings.
It is believed that Christine is currently in Ibiza as she prepares to film the new series of Celebs Go Dating.
Ahead of filming the E4 show, it has been revealed that Christine would be up for dating both men and women on the show.
Christine McGuinness showed off her incredible figure in a skimpy black and leopard print bikini as she posed for a sizzling Instagram video on Wednesday
The TV personality wowed in the plunging double layered triangle top which she teamed with matching bottoms
Christine was married to TV presenter Paddy for 11 years before they split for good in 2022.
After they stayed living together for the sake of their three children, twins Leo and Penelope, and daughter Felicity, who have all been diagnosed with autism, the ex-couple finalised their divorce out of court last summer.
Christine has revealed how 'difficult' the breakup had been for her, as the pair's marital home, a Cheshire mansion worth £6.5million, was put on the market.
She said: 'I've never spoken about the reasons for our divorce, and I don't know if I ever will.
'It was a difficult time. It wasn't something that, you know, I just decided to do overnight, or that we chose to do.
'We tried, and, yeah, there just, unfortunately, there was no repairing it, you know?'
And it appears that she's keen to prove that she has well and truly moved on from the presenter with an appearance on the huge dating show.
The TV personality has admitted that she hasn't 'dated much before' so this will be a new experience for her.
Christine flaunted her tiny frame as she posed up a storm in the swimwear for a bathroom mirror selfie
It is believed that Christine is currently in Ibiza as she prepares to film the new series of Celebs Go Dating and has revealed that she would be up for dating both men and women on the show
The TV personality will no doubt have viewers invested after her divorce from ex-husband Paddy McGuinness (pictured in 2017)
She said: 'I'm really excited to be joining the agency, I'm going to have a summer of fun! Who knows what might happen? I've not really dated much before, so I feel like I'm doing a crash course!
'I'm looking forward to getting to know the other celebs and I'm especially looking forward to the coaching side of things with the agents. I think that's going to be good for me.'
Christine will be joined by the likes of Kerry Katona, 44, Love Island star Olivia Hawkins, 29, S Club 7 singer Jon Lee, 43, and Mark 'The Beast' Labbett, 59, on Celebs Go Dating.
The cast of singletons jetted to the White Isle on Monday to start filming with relationship experts Paul C. Brunson and Anna Williamson, as comedian Rob Beckett returns as the show's narrator.
A TV source told The Sun: 'Show bosses are delighted to have snapped up Christine, they think she'll be great on-screen and appeal to lots of other women in their thirties dating after getting a divorce.
'Fans will see a new side to Christine too as she opens up about her personal life and films coaching sessions with the show's dating experts.
'Christine has been open on social media about how she found spirituality and healing in Ibiza, so she's thrilled to be working over there.'

argos_summary: Christine McGuinness has decided to quit the upcoming series of 'Celebs Go Dating', feeling it is too soon for her to date publicly following her divorce from Paddy McGuinness. Despite initially being excited about the show and open to dating both men and women, she expressed discomfort during filming and ultimately chose to return home to her family. Christine has shared her struggles with the breakup and the challenges of co-parenting their three children, all diagnosed with autism.
